intro: Struthanthus terniflorus, commonly known as the three-flowered struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple, and it has hairy, glandular leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. The plant is known for its resilience to drought and heat, making it well adapted to its native habitat.
